comments.body: Add a `silent` param with docstring description to each framework-specific autologging function (e.g. `mlflow.fastai.autolog()`, `mlflow.sklearn.autolog()`). Also add the `silent` parameter to the universal `mlflow.autolog()` function.

Looks like we're missing `disable_for_unsupported_versions` in `mlflow.autolog()`. Can we add this argument to `mlflow.autolog()` (defined in `mlflow/fluent.py`) & ensure that we have test coverage in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/tracking/fluent/test_fluent_autolog.py#L123-L137?
Fixing this logical error since I caught it in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/3735/files#r530146856 as well

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +406,410 @@            tmp_list[callback_arg_index] += [__MLflowFastaiCallback(self)]
            args = tuple(tmp_list)
        elif kwargs.get("callbacks"):
            callbacks += list(kwargs["callbacks"])
            kwargs["callbacks"] += [__MLflowFastaiCallback(self)]

comments.body: No action needed, just a note that I confirmed that `signature` & `input_example` are not valid arguments to [export](https://docs.fast.ai/basic_train.html#Learner.export)
BTW, do we also plan to document these params for `log_model` in a follow-up (IMO we should)?
what do you mean? You mean to update the models.rst docs?

Basically, we probably want to update the docs for [`mlflow.fastai.log_model`](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/66a54d5aa5829abe06b8020a36e328ccb031397f/mlflow/fastai.py#L109) & analogous methods in other flavors to mention that `signature` and `input_example` are valid arguments (& actually in the fastai case, that they won't be passed to `fastai.Learner.export` [as the docs currently state](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/66a54d5aa5829abe06b8020a36e328ccb031397f/mlflow/fastai.py#L135))
Oops, sorry I somehow missed that this PR also updates the log_model docstrings - nvm!

@@ -1,1 +78,82 @@    :param mlflow_model: MLflow model config this flavor is being added to.

    :param signature: (Experimental) :py:class:`ModelSignature <mlflow.models.ModelSignature>`
                      describes model input and output :py:class:`Schema <mlflow.types.Schema>`.
                      The model signature can be :py:func:`inferred <mlflow.models.infer_signature>`

comments.body:
@antoniomdk 

Why do you convert `model_data_path` to a path object here?

Because `Learner.export` receives a Path, String, or an opened file. If I pass a string it will it as a relative location, that's why I need to pass a Path object. More info here:

https://docs.fast.ai/basic_train.html#Learner.export
Thanks for the clear explanation. I understand.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +88,92 @@    model_data_subpath = "model.fastai"
    model_data_path = os.path.join(path, model_data_subpath)
    model_data_path = Path(model_data_path)
    os.makedirs(path)
